Aishaâ€™s Age at Marriage
With the exception of one source, all sources suggest that Aisha was between 19 and 22 years old when she was married to the Prophet. The younger age was interpolated during the Abbasids to counter the Shiites due to her fierce opposition to Ali. Abbasid supporters lowered her age to portray her as â€œdivinely intended Virginâ€ to boost her credentials and credibility in opposing Aliâ€™s claim. This report of her age being 9 comes ONLY through one source Hisham bin Urwa while all other historical sources put her age between 17 and 22 at the time of her marriage. According to respected historian Yaqub bin Shaibah: â€œnarratives reported by Hisham are reliable except those that are reported through the people of Iraq" and since this particular narration came through Iraqis it is not reliable since all other historical facts counter this myth perpetrated by supporters of Abbasid regime. Malik ibn Anas also objected on narrations of Hisham through Iraqis. No one else from 100,000 of Prophetâ€™c ompanions corroborated this age, if it were at least one more person should have mentioned this fact. Author of Mizanu'l-ai`tidal reported that Hishamâ€™s memory suffered quite badly in his old age and since he moved to Iraq when he was 71 years old, his narrations at that age are not deemed reliable
1.	Aisha was 19 at the time of her marriage: According to Ibne Kathir â€“ author of Quranâ€™s most respected exegesis, Aisha's sister Asma was born in 595 CE, was 10 days older than Aisha and was 27 years old at the time of Emigration. Aisha was born in 605 CE and would then be 17 years old at the time of the Emigration and at the time of her marriage was at least 19 since her marriage to the Prophet happened in 2nd Hijra after the War of Badar. (References: Taqri'bu'l-tehzi'b as well as Al-bidayah wa'l-nihayah)
2.	Aisha was 18. Author of famous Hadith collection â€œMishkat ul Masabeehâ€ wites in â€œahmadl fil Asma ul-Rijjalâ€: â€œAt the time of the consummation of her marriage Syedah Aishaâ€™s age was no less than 18 to 19 years.â€ Additionally, according to Ibn Hisham Aisha converted to Islam before Umar around 610 CE. She must be at least six or seven to be able to accept Islam voluntarily. That would put her age between 18 and 19 at the time of her marriage at 622 CE
3.	Aisha was 20 or 21 at the time of her marriage. Aishaâ€™s brother Abdur Rahman was 22 years old at the time of Badar and since she was born right after him,  that would also support this theory that she was 20 or 21 at that time. According to Tabari Abu Bakar wanted to expedite Aishaâ€™s marriage to Mutaâ€™am in 615 CE before his emigration to Ethiopia but his father Mutâ€™im refused because of Abubakarâ€™s conversion to Islam. Aisha would at least be 10 at this time. And will therefore be 21 on her wedding in 622 CE. Aisha reported that she was a young girl at the time of revelation of Sura Qamar. Qamar was revealed 9 years before Emigration. If Aisha was 9 at this time, she will 20 at the time of her wedding in 2AH
4.	Aisha was 17 at the time of her marriage:  Historical accounts suggest that she died in 58 Hijri at the age 0f 74. This indicates that she was born three years before start of his Mission and was therefore 17 at the time of her marriage
According to The Infancy Gospel of James, Chapter 8 verse 2 to Chapter 9 verse 11 which Eastern Churches believe in Mother Mary - mother of Jesus - was 12 years old and Joseph was 90 years old when they married. Catholic Encyclopedia (http://www.newadvent.org/cathen/08504a.htm) also narrates that Joseph was 90 and Mary between 12-14 when two were married.
